intro: Alcea lavateriflora var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, soft down that gives the plant its "glabrescens" variety name. This plant thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
